Two-thirds of space junk is close to Earth

But when it comes to the worst idea in the

178.text:

202.text:
On May 9, 1963 the Project West Ford satellite
released 20 kilograms of copper wire above

208.text:
the Earth. It slowly formed a ring of metal
between the north and south poles, too small

213.text:
to see with the naked eye, but dense enough
to bounce radio signals off of.

217.text:
Those copper needles were very light, so most
have probably fallen back to Earth, but thanks

222.text:
to the extreme cold of space many of the Project
West Ford needles were welded into clumps,

227.text: and are still orbiting Earth to this day.
